summary: The 'Activating National Parks in Cities Act' (H.R. 1429) aims to expand the National Park Service's mission to include the active use of park units located in urban areas. The bill defines "active use" to include amenities and activities that enhance public enjoyment and improve quality of life, focusing on playgrounds, pedestrian- and bicycle-friendly infrastructure, sports facilities, community events, and concessions. It also defines "urban area" based on U.S. Census Bureau designations.
